Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ عدر [عَدُوُّ] لَذَّتِهِ
enWisdom: The intelligent one is the enemy of his delectation

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ أَمَاتَ شَهْوَتَهُ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who annihilates his lust

Wisdom: الْقَوِيُّ مَنْ قَمَعَ لَذَّتَهُ
enWisdom: A strong person is one who subdues his pleasures

Wisdom: أَعْظَمُ مُلْكٍ مُلْكُ النَّفْسِ
enWisdom: The greatest mastery is mastery over the soul

Wisdom: أَقْوَى النَّاسِ مَنْ قَوِيَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: The strongest person is one who gains an upper hand over his [carnal] soul

Wisdom: أَغْلَبُ النَّاسِ مَنْ غَلَبَ هَوَاهُ بِعِلْمِهِ
enWisdom: The most important knowledge for you is that without which [your good] action is not accepted

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ النَّاسِ مَنْ عَصَى هَوَاهُ وَأَفْضَلُ مِنْهُ مَنْ رَفَضَ دُنْيَاهُ
enWisdom: The best person is one who resists his vain desires and better than him is he who rejects [the pleasures of] his worldly life

Wisdom: إِنَّ النَّفْسَ أَبْعَدُ شَيْ‏ءٍ مَنْزَعاً وَإِنَّهَا لَا تَزَالُ تَنْزِعُ إِلَى مَعْصِيَةٍ فِي هَوًى
enWisdom: Verily the soul has far-reaching desires and continues to be inclined towards disobedience in its desires

Wisdom: تَرْكُ الشَّهَوَاتِ أَفْضَلُ عِبَادَةٍ وَأَجْمَلُ عَادَةٍ
enWisdom: Abandoning lustful desires is the best worship and the most beautiful habit

Wisdom: خَيْرُ النَّاسِ مَنْ أَخْرَجَ الْحِرْصَ مِنْ قَلْبِهِ وَعَصَى هَوَاهُ فِي طَاعَةِ رَبِّهِ
enWisdom: The best person is one who removes greed from his heart and resists his vain desires in obedience to his Lord

Wisdom: خَالِفِ الْهَوَى تَسْلَمْ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ الدُّنْيَا تَغْنَمْ
enWisdom: Oppose vain desire and you will be safe; turn away from this world and you will benefit

Wisdom: رَأْسُ الدِّينِ مُخَالَفَةُ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: The cornerstone of religion is opposing vain desire

Wisdom: رَدْعُ النَّفْسِ عَنِ الْهَوَى الْجِهَادُ الْأَكْبَرُ
enWisdom: Deterring the soul from vain desire is the greater Jihad

Wisdom: رَدْعُ النَّفْسِ عَنِ الْهَوَى هُوَ الْجِهَادُ النَّافِعُ
enWisdom: Deterring the soul from vain desire is the Jihad that is beneficial

Wisdom: رَدْعُ النَّفْسِ عَنْ تَسْوِيلِ الْهَوَى ثَمَرَةُ النُّبْلِ
enWisdom: Deterring the soul from the temptation of vain desire is the fruit of nobility

Wisdom: رَدْعُ النَّفْسِ عَنْ زَخَارِفِ الدُّنْيَا ثَمَرَةُ الْعَقْلِ
enWisdom: Deterring the soul from the vanities of this world is the fruit of reason

Wisdom: رَدْعُ الْهَوَى شِيمَةُ الْعُقَلَاءِ
enWisdom: Deterring [the self from] vain desire is a trait of the intelligent ones

Wisdom: صَلَاحُ النَّفْسِ مُجَاهَدَةُ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: Reformation of the soul is [achieved by] struggling against vain desires

Wisdom: ضَادُّوا الشَّهْوَةَ مُضَادَّةَ الضِّدِّ ضِدَّهُ وَحَارِبُوهَا مُحَارَبَةَ الْعَدُوِّ الْعَدُوَّ
enWisdom: Oppose lust as a rival would oppose his rival and fight it as an enemy would fight his enemy

Wisdom: غَالِبِ الْهَوَى مُغَالَبَةَ الْخَصْمِ خَصْمَهُ وَحَارِبْهُ مُحَارَبَةَ الْعَدُوِّ عَدُوَّهُ لَعَلَّكَ تَمْلِكُهُ
enWisdom: Combat vain desire just as an adversary would combat his adversary, and battle it the way an enemy would battle his enemy, [if successful] you may gain mastery over it

Wisdom: غَالِبِ الشَّهْوَةَ قَبْلَ قُوَّةِ ضَرَاوَتِهَا فَإِنَّهَا إِنْ قَوِيَتْ [عَلَيْكَ‏] مَلَكَتْكَ وَاسْتَفَادَتْكَ وَلَمْ تَقْدِرْ عَلَى مُقَاوَمَتِهَا
enWisdom: Overcome [your] lust before it ferocity becomes strong, for verily if it becomes strong it will possess you and use you, and you will not be able to stand up against it

Wisdom: فَازَ مَنْ غَلَبَ هَوَاهُ وَمَلَكَ دَوَاعِيَ نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: He who overcomes his vain desire and controls the urges of his [carnal] soul is successful

Wisdom: فَسَادُ النَّفْسِ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: The corruption of the soul is [caused by] vain desire

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ كَيْساً أَنْ يَغْلِبَ الْهَوَى وَيَمْلِكَ النُّهَى
enWisdom: It is a sufficient sagacity for a person to overcome his vain desire and possess intelligence

Wisdom: كُنْ لِهَوَاكَ غَالِباً وَلِنَجَاتِكَ طَالِباً
enWisdom: Be a conqueror of your vain desire and a seeker of your salvation

Wisdom: مَنْ مَلَكَ [هَلَكَ‏] هَوَاهُ مَلَكَ النُّهَى
enWisdom: Whoever controls his vain desire acquires intelligence [and wisdom]

Wisdom: مَنْ يَغْلِبْ هَوَاهُ يَعِزَّ
enWisdom: Whoever overcomes his vain desire is honoured

Wisdom: مَنْ أَمَاتَ شَهْوَتَهُ أَحْيَا مُرُوَّتَهُ
enWisdom: One who kills his lust rejuvenates his magnanimity

Wisdom: مَنْ غَلَبَ شَهْوَتَهُ صَانَ قَدْرَهُ
enWisdom: One who overcomes his lust, protects his status

Wisdom: مَنْ أَحَبَّ نَيْلَ الدَّرَجَاتِ الْعُلَى فَلْيَغْلِبِ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: Whoever wishes to attain lofty stations should overcome his vain desire

Wisdom: مِلَاكُ الدِّينِ مُخَالَفَةُ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: The basis of religion is opposing vain desires

Wisdom: نِظَامُ الدِّينِ مُخَالَفَةُ الْهَوَى وَالتَّنَزُّهُ عَنِ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: The structure of religion is [based on] opposing vain desires and keeping away from [the unlawful pleasures of] this world

Wisdom: لَا قَوِيَّ أَقْوَى مِمَّنْ قَوِيَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ فَمَلَكَهَا
enWisdom: There is none stronger than he who overpowers his soul thereby gaining mastery over it
